deckTypes.name: Lord of the Mysteries - 22 Pathways
deckTypes.description: The 22 Beyonder pathways from Lord of the Mysteries, depicting you in each divine role

deckTypes.name: Traditional Rider-Waite Tarot
deckTypes.description: Classic tarot symbolism with historical accuracy

deckTypes.name: Japanese Shinto Tarot
deckTypes.description: Kami spirits and Japanese spiritual traditions

deckTypes.name: Buddhist Arcana
deckTypes.description: Bodhisattva path and dismantling of self

deckTypes.name: Advaita Vedanta Arcana
deckTypes.description: Non-dual lens: cards as superimpositions masking the Self

traditional.name: The Fool
traditional.meaning: New beginnings, taking a leap of faith, being carefree
traditional.prompt: A person standing at the edge of a cliff, one foot lifted as if about to step off into the unknown, sun shining behind them, carrying a small bundle, white dog at their feet, mountains in background, tarot card art style

lordOfMysteries.abilities: Grafting, Historical Void Projection, Miracle Invocation
lordOfMysteries.prompt: Tarot card: 0 - THE FOOL (Lord of the Mysteries). Render the title. A vagabond/seer at the edge of a precipice, one foot into the void, torn clothes, small bundle. The apex Fool carries all lower-sequence tricks: divination tools, warped illusions, faceless mask, clown's grin, marionette strings tugging reality, muscle and expression control. Miracles crackle, duplicates peel off, objects from the past appear. The air is a mysterious field of tampering and concealment, black eyes glinting, cosmic symbols around an impossible cliff.

egyptian.prompt: Ancient Egyptian deity Ra with solar disk crown, golden rays emanating, hieroglyphics in background, desert landscape, falcon-headed figure in royal regalia

celtic.prompt: Celtic druid figure with sacred oak staff, standing in ancient stone circle, mist swirling, Celtic knotwork patterns, mystical forest background

shinto.prompt: Japanese goddess emerging from cave, radiant light, mirror and jewels, torii gate, cherry blossoms, traditional Japanese art style

advaita.name: Jivatma in Lila
advaita.prompt: Advaita tarot card: the jivatma stepping from a radiant cliff of the Absolute into the ocean of samsara, small bundle of prarabdha karma on a stick, playful smile, sunlit void behind, sense of cosmic play

cards.personalLore: FILL THIS: Your story for this card - what aspect of your life does this represent? What vocation, lesson, or role?

narrative.summary: Potential, faith, beginnings, edge between trust and stupidity.
narrative.feel: Held breath at the edge; terror and wonder together.
narrative.stance: Alone with the world as witness; environment bigger than the figure.
narrative.scene: Mid-step off an impossible ledge, cliff bending toward their foot as if reality wants to catch them.
narrative.question: What are you willing to risk not understanding, if it means truly living?

traditional.name: The Magician
traditional.prompt: A person standing at a table with the four tarot suits (wand, cup, sword, pentacle), one hand pointing up to sky and one down to earth, infinity symbol above head, red roses and white lilies, confident expression

lordOfMysteries.abilities: Knowledge Projection, Perfect Replication, Mystery Enhancement
lordOfMysteries.prompt: Sequence 0 - PARAGON. A master inventor-scholar in a workshop-temple where floating tomes, star charts, gears, and alchemical glassware fuse with runes. They wield perfect scientific and historical knowledge, craft living artifacts, pour spirit into machines, alter the laws of physics, and blend mysticism with technology. Tools, weapon schematics, and glowing formulae orbit them as reality is rewritten.

egyptian.prompt: Ibis-headed deity Thoth holding ankh and was scepter, ancient scrolls floating, moon disk crown, hieroglyphic texts glowing with power

celtic.prompt: Druid wizard in flowing robes, crystal staff, ancient grimoire open before them, Celtic symbols glowing, mystical energy swirling

shinto.prompt: Scholarly figure in traditional Japanese robes, calligraphy brush and scrolls, plum blossoms, peaceful temple setting, aura of wisdom

advaita.name: Ishvara the Magician
advaita.prompt: Cosmic creator (Brahma/Ishvara) at an altar with four Vedas like tarot suits, weaving the universe with maya shakti, swirling galaxies and sacred geometry forming, serene authority

cards.personalLore: FILL THIS: Your story for The Magician - what skills have you mastered? What powers do you wield?

narrative.summary: Mastery, intention, manifestation, channeling versus manipulation.
narrative.feel: Sharp, focused current from crown to fingertips, like holding a live wire on purpose.
narrative.stance: Between above and below, half priest, half performer; power flows through and draws eyes.
narrative.scene: One hand to sky, one to earth; tools half sacred, half stage props, miracle blurring with trick.
narrative.question: Are you serving something larger than yourself, or just bending appearances to your will?

traditional.name: The High Priestess
traditional.meaning: Intuition, higher powers, mystery, subconscious mind
traditional.prompt: A serene figure seated between two pillars (one black marked B, one white marked J), crescent moon crown, Torah scroll in lap, pomegranates on veil behind, calm waters

lordOfMysteries.abilities: Secret Keeping, Knowledge Theft, Mystic Revelation
lordOfMysteries.prompt: Hidden Sage in a shadowed infinite library of whispered secrets, listening to entities beyond sight. Shelves vanish into darkness; spirit threads carry murmurs. The sage veils reality, steals and reveals truths, grazes souls for knowledge, and hides within moving shadows. Glowing runes for concealment, half-seen figures eavesdropping, a sense of forbidden knowing kept perfectly still.

egyptian.prompt: Egyptian goddess Isis with throne crown, wings spread protectively, ankh symbol, mystical spells visible in air, temple setting

celtic.prompt: Celtic goddess figure with sacred flame, triple spiral symbol, healing herbs, standing at holy well, ethereal presence

shinto.prompt: Graceful goddess dancing with mirror, sakura petals falling, soft dawn light, mystical and serene atmosphere

advaita.name: Saraswati Veil and Revelation
advaita.prompt: Goddess Saraswati seated before a translucent veil, moonlit library of truth, holding scripture that distinguishes sat from asat, calm waters and lotus, gaze of pure discernment

cards.personalLore: FILL THIS: Your High Priestess moment - what intuitive knowledge guides you? What mysteries do you hold?

narrative.summary: Spirituality, intuition, inner stillness, mystery of the unspoken.
narrative.feel: Cool moonlight behind the eyes; soft weight in the chest saying you already know.
narrative.stance: Turned slightly away, seated at the threshold; guardian of a veil, not its owner.
narrative.scene: Between two pillars with a veiled backdrop of stars and deep water; a closed book rests on their lap.
narrative.question: What truth are you pretending you do not already feel in your bones?

traditional.name: The Empress
traditional.prompt: A regal figure seated on throne in lush garden, crown of twelve stars, Venus symbol on shield, wheat field, waterfall, pregnant with creative abundance

lordOfMysteries.abilities: Beauty Manipulation, Dream Weaving, Psychological Corruption
lordOfMysteries.prompt: Mother Goddess of Depravity, sovereign of all feminine forces, bathed in crimson moonlight. Reality warps into beautiful nightmares; roses with thorny madness curl around her. Echoes of banshees and decadent madames, mirror-world allure, corruption presented as desire. Soft hands cradle and ruin at once; the atmosphere is luxurious, dangerous, and inescapably enchanting.

egyptian.prompt: Cow-horned goddess Hathor with solar disk, sistrum rattle, joyful expression, flowers and music notes, celebration atmosphere

celtic.prompt: Earth mother figure in flowing green robes, rivers flowing from hands, flowers blooming at feet, ancient sacred landscape

shinto.prompt: Figure surrounded by white foxes, rice fields golden in sunset, torii gates, abundant harvest, prosperity symbols

advaita.name: Prakriti the Field
advaita.prompt: Prakriti as a lush earth mother, fertile fields and forests, vines and grain overflowing, sensory world as womb of forms, beautiful and inviting yet transient

cards.personalLore: FILL THIS: Your creative abundance - what have you nurtured into being? What grows under your care?

narrative.summary: Decadence, nurturing, feminine abundance vs smothering excess.
narrative.feel: Warmth spreading through belly and chest, like lying in the sun after a feast.
narrative.stance: Surrounded by others, plants, textures, sounds; everything wants to grow closer.
narrative.scene: Reclining on vines and cushions, fruits and flowers spilling over; a wilted bloom hints at unpruned abundance.
narrative.question: Where does true nourishment end and overindulgence begin in how you treat yourself and others?

traditional.name: The Emperor
traditional.prompt: A commanding figure on stone throne, crown and armor, holding ankh scepter, ram heads on throne, barren mountains behind, absolute authority

lordOfMysteries.abilities: Order Bestowal, Rule Enforcement, Parasitic Control
lordOfMysteries.prompt: Black Emperor on an obsidian throne, crown of black flames, fortress bending to their will. Laws twist visibly: contracts and verdicts float, gold coins for bribery, strings of authority circle like chains. Abstract rules become sigils, the environment isolates under their order, and every decree magnifies in power. A sense of endless resurrection so long as their command stands.

egyptian.prompt: Falcon-headed deity Horus with double crown of Egypt, holding was scepter and ankh, Eye of Horus symbol prominent, regal pose

celtic.prompt: Celtic king with silver prosthetic arm, sword of light, standing before hill fort, warriors' respect, noble bearing

shinto.prompt: Imperial figure in traditional Japanese armor, sacred regalia, standing before Mount Fuji, divine authority, founding presence

advaita.name: Vishnu the Preserver
advaita.prompt: Vishnu seated on a cosmic throne above calm ocean, conch and discus in hand, radiant grid of order around him, protective gaze maintaining the dream's structure

cards.personalLore: FILL THIS: Your empire - what structures have you built? What do you rule over?

narrative.summary: Leadership, authority, structure, tension between protection and control.
narrative.feel: Weight in the shoulders like armor—comforting and heavy.
narrative.stance: Elevated above others but facing them; responsible for them yet tempted to be above them.
narrative.scene: Stone throne carved into a mountainside; a glowing city below, stable but unmoving.
narrative.question: Where are you building solid ground—and where are you turning living beings into bricks?

traditional.name: The Hierophant
traditional.meaning: Spiritual wisdom, religious beliefs, conformity, tradition
traditional.prompt: A religious figure seated between two pillars, triple crown, two crossed keys, two acolytes kneeling, blessing gesture, formal religious setting

lordOfMysteries.abilities: Weather Control, Ocean Dominion, Calamity Bringing
lordOfMysteries.prompt: Tyrant towering over tempestuous seas and lightning-streaked skies, omnipotent across sea, land, and air. Water, wind, and electricity coil around; a trident raised as sea creatures heed the call. Stormsong disables foes; gusts lift them; earthquakes rumble. Moves at lightning speed, generating star-level electrical fury, hair streaming with salt and stormlight.

egyptian.prompt: Green-skinned deity Osiris with crook and flail, atef crown, throne in underworld, scales of judgment, eternal wisdom

celtic.prompt: Elder druid in white robes, golden sickle, standing in sacred grove, oak trees, teaching younger druids, ancient wisdom

shinto.prompt: Wise guide figure at crossroads shrine, lantern light, showing the way, traditional robes, protective presence

advaita.name: Guru Pointing to the Moon
advaita.prompt: Adi Shankara-like guru teaching in temple courtyard, one finger pointing to the full moon, palm-leaf texts with mahavakyas open, devoted student listening, lamp of knowledge glowing

cards.personalLore: FILL THIS: Your teachings - what wisdom do you pass down? What traditions do you uphold?

narrative.summary: Tradition, conformity, teaching, lineage versus empty ritual.
narrative.feel: Grounded spine, hands in a familiar gesture; comfort in patterns with an itch to question.
narrative.stance: Between unseen source and gathered group, translating something old into something usable.
narrative.scene: Teacher on temple steps, students at varying distances; some awake, others glazed in motion without meaning.
narrative.question: Which of your "shoulds" are wise inheritance—and which are habits you are afraid to outgrow?

traditional.name: The Lovers
traditional.prompt: Two figures standing together in garden of Eden, angel Raphael blessing from above, tree of knowledge with serpent, tree of life, sun shining, naked innocence

lordOfMysteries.abilities: War Declaration, Strategic Foresight, Provocation Mastery
lordOfMysteries.prompt: Red Priest amid a war-torn battlefield, crimson vestments and iron-black eyes. Fire traps and banners blaze; conspiratorial diagrams and provoke-hexes hang in the air. Enhanced strength and agility fuel decisive strikes; weather bends, meteoric fire trails from their form. Represents the masculine catastrophe: war liturgy, provocation, and strategic carnage.

egyptian.deity: Nut and Geb - Sky and Earth
egyptian.prompt: Goddess Nut arching over Earth god Geb, stars on her body, their separation creating world, cosmic love and separation

celtic.prompt: Two swan figures transforming into lovers, lakeside setting, Celtic love knot, magical transformation, romantic atmosphere

shinto.prompt: Divine couple on heavenly bridge stirring ocean with jeweled spear, islands forming, creating Japan together, harmonious creation

advaita.name: Ardhanarishvara
advaita.prompt: Ardhanarishvara, body half Shiva half Parvati, seamless union of masculine and feminine, background symbols of duality dissolving, serene realization of not-two

cards.personalLore: FILL THIS: Your partnerships - what choices have defined you? Who stands beside you?

narrative.summary: Partnership, emotion, balance, sacred weight of choosing.
narrative.feel: Heart pulled in two directions; ache and sweetness braided.
narrative.stance: At least two beings with a third presence of fate or value hovering between.
narrative.scene: Two figures reach toward each other while a constellation above forms a third shape they must also embrace.
narrative.question: Who are you becoming by choosing this bond—or by refusing to choose?

traditional.name: The Chariot
traditional.prompt: A warrior standing in chariot pulled by two sphinxes (one black, one white), starry canopy, armor with moon symbols, city behind, victorious advance

lordOfMysteries.abilities: Probability Manipulation, Fate Weaving, Luck Stealing
lordOfMysteries.prompt: Key of Stars standing among spinning wheels of fate and probability, cosmic dice rolling. Hands trace sigils that store and release luck, turning certainties uncertain. Threads of destiny loop opponents into endless cycles; divination circles predict outcomes before they unfold. A door of stars hints at space-walking travel between worlds.

egyptian.prompt: Falcon-headed war god Montu in war chariot, wielding weapons, solar disk with uraeus, charging into battle, unstoppable force

celtic.prompt: Celtic warrior in battle chariot, Gae Bolg spear, warp spasm transformation, charging into battle, legendary prowess

shinto.prompt: Divine warrior in samurai armor, bow and arrows, standing victorious, protective presence over warriors, honorable strength

advaita.name: Arjuna on the Chariot
advaita.prompt: Arjuna on his chariot at Kurukshetra, bow lowered in contemplation, horses steady, inner light of Krishna as guide behind him, acting without attachment to results

cards.personalLore: FILL THIS: Your victories - what battles have you won? What drives you forward?

narrative.summary: Prowess, determination, momentum, risk of being driven by drive.
narrative.feel: Leaning forward in the chest, adrenaline humming in the legs.
narrative.stance: Ahead of the crowd, pulled by forces that must be steered.
narrative.scene: Chariot pulled by two creatures veering apart, driver calm with loose but intentional reins; road ahead splits.
narrative.question: Are you steering your momentum—or letting speed decide where you end up?

traditional.name: Strength
traditional.prompt: A gentle figure calmly closing or petting a lion's mouth, infinity symbol above head, flower crown, mountain background, inner strength and gentleness

lordOfMysteries.abilities: Purification, Divine Light, Restraint of Evil
lordOfMysteries.prompt: Eternal Blazing Sun radiant with holy light, wings and corona forming an ocean of brilliance. Traditional priestly chants buff allies and weaken foes; light and fire spells purify and exorcise. In a single gesture they can lower an enemy's Sequence, create an area of relentless light, and seal contracts of truth. Gold-white glow, scales of justice hinted in the halo.

egyptian.prompt: Lioness-headed goddess Sekhmet with solar disk, both fierce warrior and healer, balancing destruction and protection, powerful presence

celtic.prompt: Warrior woman training heroes, Isle of Skye setting, wielding legendary spear, teaching discipline through strength, formidable yet wise

shinto.prompt: Powerful deity taming the eight-headed serpent Yamata no Orochi, storm and courage, wild strength becoming heroic, dramatic confrontation

advaita.name: Durga Riding the Lion
advaita.prompt: Goddess Durga serene atop a lion or tiger, gently taming the beast, weapons calm, aura of sattvic strength as rajas and tamas swirl like a storm she rides above

cards.personalLore: FILL THIS: Your strength - what beasts have you tamed? What inner power sustains you?

narrative.summary: Control, fortitude, resilience, softness within strength.
narrative.feel: Steady warm pressure in chest and hands; holding a trembling animal without squeezing.
narrative.stance: Close to something wild, choosing to soothe rather than dominate.
narrative.scene: Hand on the muzzle of a roaring beast; broken chains in grass, eyes softening.
narrative.question: What happens when you stop gripping so hard and trust you are strong enough to stay open?

traditional.name: The Hermit
traditional.meaning: Soul searching, introspection, being alone, inner guidance
traditional.prompt: An old wise figure standing alone on mountain peak, holding lantern with six-pointed star, staff in other hand, snow-covered mountains, seeking wisdom in solitude

lordOfMysteries.abilities: Perfect Calculation, Future Sight, Knowledge Accumulation
lordOfMysteries.prompt: Eye of Wisdom solitary on a peak of calculations and constellations. This Hermit of the occult conjures star maps, divines, casts ritual spells, and scribes scrolls. At apex they hear hidden existences, travel the spirit world, self-create spells, drain power from knowledge itself, and foresee woven fate. Lantern of insight, staff of a sage, cosmic equations around them.

egyptian.prompt: Jackal-headed deity Anubis holding ankh, guiding souls through afterlife, torch illuminating path, protective solitude, ancient wisdom

celtic.prompt: Ancient bard in meditation, harp beside them, cauldron of wisdom, visions of past and future, solitary enlightenment

shinto.prompt: Contemplative deity in meditation, surrounded by scrolls of wisdom, peaceful shrine setting, deep thought and understanding

advaita.name: Dakshinamurti the Hermit
advaita.prompt: Dakshinamurti under a great banyan tree, silent teaching mudra, lamp glowing in the cave of the heart, mountains and stars beyond, disciple absorbing wordless guidance

cards.personalLore: FILL THIS: Your solitude - what wisdom have you found alone? What light do you carry?

narrative.summary: Solitude, wisdom, self-reflection, chosen aloneness vs fearful withdrawal.
narrative.feel: Cool air around the body, small lantern warmth held close.
narrative.stance: Distant from the crowd but not against it; watcher on the hill.
narrative.scene: Lone figure on a high path, lantern over a drop; town lights below, path turns further inward.
narrative.question: Are you stepping away to see clearly—or hiding because the world is looking back?

traditional.name: Wheel of Fortune
traditional.meaning: Good luck, karma, life cycles, destiny, turning point
traditional.prompt: A great wheel surrounded by clouds, sphinx on top, snake descending, Anubis ascending, four winged creatures in corners reading books, TARO letters, alchemical symbols

lordOfMysteries.abilities: Desire Amplification, Mutation Granting, Wish Twisting
lordOfMysteries.prompt: Mother Tree of Desire as a colossal, beautiful yet corrupt tree-being. Roots clutch treasure and skulls, branches drip with tempting fruit and seductive flowers. Grants twisted wishes, mutates reality, births chimeras and crossbreeds, and exudes overwhelming desire. Vines coil like serpents; a patriarchal trunk pulses with hunger beneath a crimson moon.

egyptian.prompt: Scarab-headed deity Khepri rolling sun disk, representing eternal cycles of death and rebirth, transformation and renewal

celtic.prompt: Goddess at spinning wheel weaving fate, surrounded by stars and seasons, Celtic wheel of the year, cosmic cycles

shinto.prompt: Smiling deity Ebisu with fishing rod and sea bream, symbols of fortune flowing around, lucky opportunities manifesting

advaita.name: Kala-Chakra
advaita.prompt: Wheel of time turning in the sky, three gunas as colored spokes driving it, beings rising and falling on the rim, seasons and stars spinning in endless motion

cards.personalLore: FILL THIS: Your turning points - what cycles have shaped you? Where has fate led you?

narrative.summary: Luck, change, fate, cycles turning beyond personal will.
narrative.axis: Dancing with Change vs Clinging to Control
narrative.feel: Lurch in the stomach like a Ferris wheel tipping over the top.
narrative.stance: Entangled with forces larger than will—systems, timing, others.
narrative.scene: Great wheel turning in the sky with figures rising, falling, climbing back by choice.
narrative.question: Where are you mistaking a temporary position on the wheel for your identity?

traditional.name: Justice
traditional.meaning: Justice, fairness, truth, cause and effect, law
traditional.prompt: A crowned figure seated on throne between two pillars, holding upright sword in right hand and balanced scales in left, purple cloak, impartial judgment

lordOfMysteries.abilities: Crime Detection, Punishment Execution, Law Enforcement
lordOfMysteries.prompt: Adjudicator in a divine court, balanced scales and upright sword glowing. They defend Order itself: setting rules that punish when broken, striking minds and souls, detecting anomalies, and negating Beyonder powers. Verdicts spoken become binding laws; chaos is forced into obedience. Law sigils, explosive seals, and an unblinking gaze of absolute justice.

egyptian.prompt: Goddess Ma'at with ostrich feather of truth, scales weighing heart against feather, maintaining cosmic balance and order

celtic.prompt: Druidic judge holding scales and rod of office, ancient law texts, oak grove court, dispensing traditional justice

shinto.prompt: Graceful deity Benzaiten with biwa instrument, flowing water representing balance and harmony, wise judgment

advaita.name: Yama's Scales
advaita.prompt: Lord Yama standing stern yet impartial, holding scales and a mirror of truth, rod of dharma by his side, souls weighed under an unblinking cosmic law

cards.personalLore: FILL THIS: Your justice - what balance do you maintain? What truths do you uphold?

narrative.summary: Fairness, truth, balance, cost of seeing all sides.
narrative.feel: Vertical line from crown to pelvis, breath held while scales settle.
narrative.stance: Between parties or timelines, responsible to something beyond preference.
narrative.scene: Sword and scales; a feather on one side, tangled threads on the other.
narrative.question: If every voice—including your shadow—testified, what verdict would you reach?

traditional.name: The Hanged Man
traditional.meaning: Pause, surrender, letting go, new perspective
traditional.prompt: A figure suspended upside down from living tree by one foot, other leg crossed, hands behind back, halo around head, serene expression, sacrifice and enlightenment

lordOfMysteries.abilities: Death Bringing, Peaceful Rest, Dream Walking
lordOfMysteries.prompt: Evernight Goddess cloaked in eternal night over a silent graveyard. Death pathway apex: summons and commands spirits, raises and stills the dead, walks the spirit world, resists cold and decay. A crimson moon above, black flag of death unfurled; with a gesture she resurrects or ends life instantly. Lanterns of soul-fire line the path to the underworld.

egyptian.prompt: Dwarf deity Bes in protective stance, fierce expression yet benevolent, sacrificing appearance for protection of others

celtic.prompt: Figure hanging from World Tree, sacrificing for knowledge, runes appearing, transformative wisdom through sacrifice

shinto.prompt: Princess deity walking through fire to prove purity, cherry blossoms falling, willing sacrifice for truth

advaita.name: Tapasya Inversion
advaita.prompt: Ascetic hanging calmly upside down from a sacred tree, one leg folded, fire of tapas beneath, the world inverted around him, serene face of renunciation

cards.personalLore: FILL THIS: Your sacrifice - what have you surrendered? What perspective did you gain?

narrative.summary: Release, perspective, acceptance, power of choosing not to struggle.
narrative.feel: Unclenching after fighting too long, relief and vulnerability.
narrative.stance: Suspended between action and outcome; spectators misread the pause.
narrative.scene: Hanging upside down from a living tree, calm face with halo of realization; onlookers think defeat.
narrative.question: What might you see differently if you stopped trying to fix anything at all?

traditional.name: Death
traditional.prompt: A skeletal figure in black armor riding white horse, black flag with white rose, sun rising between two towers, figures of all classes before the horse, transformation

lordOfMysteries.abilities: Catastrophe Weaving, Disease Spreading, Unnatural Beauty
lordOfMysteries.prompt: Primordial Demoness, cataclysm made seductive. Moves like an assassin, casts ritual curses, manipulates invisible threads, incites crime and plague. Mirrors shimmer with alternate worlds; natural disasters gather at her whim; petrification and disease spread like art. The feminine catastrophe of the Original Creator, alluring and deadly.

egyptian.prompt: Jackal goddess Anput overseeing mummification and passage to afterlife, transformation through death, renewal

celtic.prompt: Triple goddess as crow on battlefield, death bringing transformation, fate weaving, war goddess of endings and beginnings

shinto.prompt: Queen of Yomi underworld, transformation from creator to death deity, passage between worlds, inevitable endings

advaita.name: Kali Pralaya
advaita.prompt: Fierce Kali dancing on dissolving forms, severing the head of ego, garland of time and skulls, cosmic night swallowing name and form, liberation through destruction

cards.personalLore: FILL THIS: Your deaths - what versions of yourself have died? What transformed?

narrative.summary: Metamorphosis, transition, release, endings enabling new forms.
narrative.feel: Hollowing in the chest followed by cool spaciousness.
narrative.stance: Walking through a door that cannot be shut; leaving roles behind.
narrative.scene: Cloaked figure through a field where old structures crumble into soil; green shoots breaking through.
narrative.question: What are you keeping alive that has already finished its work?

traditional.name: Temperance
traditional.prompt: An angel with wings, one foot on land and one in water, pouring liquid between two cups, triangle in square on chest, iris flowers, mountain with crown, alchemical mixing

lordOfMysteries.abilities: Life Granting, Harvest Blessing, Natural Balance
lordOfMysteries.prompt: Mother Goddess of Harvest overflowing with plant and earth authority. Fields surge to life, vines and roots obey, chimeras and golems take form. She heals flesh and soul, splices genetics, and can drain life force back to the soil. Verdant aura with herbal tools and earthen crowns; abundance and deprivation in the same hand.

egyptian.prompt: Androgynous deity Hapi pouring water from vessels, representing Nile's balanced flooding, abundance and moderation

celtic.prompt: Sea deity managing boundaries between worlds, cloak of mist, maintaining balance between realms, flowing moderation

shinto.prompt: Central deity maintaining cosmic balance, perfect harmony of all things, centered and moderating force

advaita.name: Harihara Alchemy
advaita.prompt: Harihara, fusion of Vishnu and Shiva, holding conch and trident, ida and pingala channels braided in light, elixir poured between vessels, tranquil inner alchemy

cards.personalLore: FILL THIS: Your balance - what do you moderate? What flows through you?

narrative.summary: Balance, introspection, combining, patient mixing of opposites.
narrative.feel: Slow even breaths; warmth and coolness meeting in the center.
narrative.stance: Between extremes, mediating without erasing difference.
narrative.scene: Pouring liquid between cups, one foot on land and one on water, path winding toward dawn.
narrative.question: Where could gentler mixing serve you better than a hard either-or?

traditional.name: The Devil
traditional.meaning: Shadow self, attachment, addiction, restriction, sexuality
traditional.prompt: A horned devil figure on pedestal, inverted pentagram on forehead, two chained naked figures (male and female) with horns and tails, chains loose enough to remove, darkness and temptation

lordOfMysteries.abilities: Theft Mastery, Chain Manipulation, Desire Liberation
lordOfMysteries.prompt: Chained God bound in cursed iron yet seething with mutant power. Summons zombies and ghosts, slips through reflections, shrugs bullets with unnatural flesh, possesses others, hexes targets into harmless animals. Regenerates while sacrificing rationality; full-moon loss of control hinted. All nonliving things in a radius twitch under their command.

egyptian.prompt: Set with mysterious animal head, desert storms, necessary chaos and disruption, challenging order, raw power

celtic.prompt: Dark standing stone idol, shadows and chains, representing material bondage and dark temptations, ancient power

shinto.prompt: Horned oni figure with iron club, representing shadow self and temptation, wild chaos and restriction

advaita.name: Mahishasura Ahamkara
advaita.prompt: Mahishasura the buffalo demon bound by subtle chains of thought, masks of victim, hero, and villain floating around, ego claiming the body amid smoky palace shadows

cards.personalLore: FILL THIS: Your shadows - what chains have bound you? What temptations shape you?

narrative.summary: Excess, temptation, attachment, stories that make the cage feel like home.
narrative.feel: Tight pull in gut and throat; craving that feels like need.
narrative.stance: Bound to something once comforting now demanding obedience.
narrative.scene: Horned figure above two chained beings; chains are loose enough to slip but heads stay bowed.
narrative.question: What are you calling "just how things are" that is actually a choice you keep making?

traditional.name: The Tower
traditional.meaning: Sudden change, upheaval, chaos, revelation, awakening
traditional.prompt: A tall tower struck by lightning, crown blown off top, two figures falling from burning tower, grey clouds, sudden destruction and revelation

lordOfMysteries.abilities: Lightning Control, Storm Summoning, Destruction Bringing
lordOfMysteries.prompt: Lord of Storms atop a crumbling tower as lightning shreds the sky. Water, wind, and thunder obey; sea kingship and stormsong bend ships. Earthquakes shake foundations; air gliding and tidal surges crash upward. Moves at the speed of lightning, wielding enough electric fury to rival a star, revealing truths through destruction.

egyptian.prompt: Lioness goddess in full destructive fury, cities falling, necessary destruction before renewal, catastrophic revelation

celtic.prompt: Giant with destructive eye opening, towers falling, catastrophic power revealed, sudden upheaval

shinto.prompt: Thunder deity with drums, lightning striking, sudden awakening through destruction, divine upheaval

advaita.name: Nataraja Breaks the Pot
advaita.prompt: Nataraja dancing as a tower-like clay pot cracks open, lightning of atma vichara, space inside merging with space outside, flames clearing the debris of false self

cards.personalLore: FILL THIS: Your tower moments - what sudden changes shook you? What was revealed in collapse?

narrative.summary: Upheaval, chaos, dread, mercy in a failing structure.
narrative.feel: Floor dropping out; panic then clarity.
narrative.stance: Many people and beliefs shaken; no one fully outside the blast.
narrative.scene: Lightning splits a tower; stones and old certainties tumble, revealing open sky.
narrative.question: What have you built on that cannot bear the weight you put on it?

traditional.name: The Star
traditional.prompt: A naked figure kneeling by water, pouring water from two jugs (one into water, one onto land), large yellow star above with seven smaller stars, bird in tree, hope and renewal

lordOfMysteries.abilities: Dream Creation, Reality Writing, Hope Manifestation
lordOfMysteries.prompt: Visionary weaving dreams and minds into reality. Reads thoughts, discerns emotions, hypnotizes with a pendulum, and strolls through others' dreams. An actor's perfect expressions hide power; at apex they enter the Mind World, weave vivid illusions, control without notice, and let thoughts reshape reality. Draconic irises flash, pages of scripts orbit.

egyptian.prompt: Goddess Sopdet as star Sirius, bringing hope of Nile flood and renewal, new beginnings, celestial promise

celtic.prompt: Goddess in silver wheel of stars, Caer Arianrhod constellation, cosmic hope and renewal, stellar beauty

shinto.prompt: Star deities Orihime and Hikoboshi, wish papers on bamboo, hopeful reunion, celestial love and renewal

advaita.name: Ganga Grace
advaita.prompt: River Ganga descending from Shiva's hair to earth, starlit sky, devotee bathing in luminous water, cooling grace after a storm, quiet devotion

cards.personalLore: FILL THIS: Your hope - what stars guide you? What renewal have you experienced?

narrative.summary: Hope, faith, gentle renewal, quiet healing after devastation.
narrative.feel: Soft cool exhale after a long cry; tiny lightness in the sternum.
narrative.stance: Alone with the night sky but not lonely; guided by something vast.
narrative.scene: Kneeling by water, pouring from two vessels, anchored by a single bright star.
narrative.question: What small act of faith are you ready to take now, even if unsure it is enough?

traditional.name: The Moon
traditional.prompt: A full moon with face, two towers, path leading to mountains, dog and wolf howling, crayfish emerging from water, illusion and fear

lordOfMysteries.abilities: Nightmare Weaving, Fear Manipulation, Darkness Control
lordOfMysteries.prompt: Darkness figure under a crimson moon, domain of night, soul, and sleep. Gains strength at night, casts area sleep, pacifies souls, walks dreams, and hosts evil spirits. Controls darkness as a veil of secrecy, erases or hides things, suppresses desire, and inflicts misfortune. Shadows thicken around a hidden, unsleeping terror.

egyptian.prompt: Falcon-headed moon god Khonsu with lunar disk and crescent, night's mysteries, time passage, protective yet mysterious

celtic.prompt: Witch goddess with cauldron under full moon, transformation magic, intuitive wisdom, lunar mysteries

shinto.prompt: Moon deity Tsukuyomi in night realm, mysterious and distant, balancing sister sun, lunar wisdom and fear

advaita.name: Rope or Snake
advaita.prompt: Twilight path where a coiled rope is mistaken for a snake, torchlight revealing simple rope, half-lit landscape holding both fear and relief, lesson of superimposition

cards.personalLore: FILL THIS: Your illusions - what fears haunt you? What do you see by moonlight?

narrative.summary: Mystery, duality, darkness, uneasy beauty of not knowing.
narrative.feel: Foggy heaviness in head and gut; intuitions and fears flicker.
narrative.stance: Between tame and wild, conscious and unconscious; pulled by tides unseen.
narrative.scene: Path between a wolf and a dog howling at a huge moon; road toward strange towers, water hides depths.
narrative.question: Which fears are intuitions twisted by old wounds—and which are real warnings to honor?

traditional.name: The Sun
traditional.prompt: A bright sun with face, naked child on white horse, sunflowers, red banner, wall behind, pure joy and success

lordOfMysteries.abilities: Perfect Observation, Mind Reading, Truth Seeing
lordOfMysteries.prompt: Evernight as an all-seeing shroud of night that reveals then veils every truth. Hair like living shadow, eyes that bore through lies; evil spirits coil nearby. Suppresses emotions and desires, blankets regions in secrecy, and shifts entire areas into hidden states. Misfortune radiates like a crown; silence and clarity coexist in the endless night.

egyptian.prompt: Sun god Ra at noon in solar barque, maximum power and glory, life-giving rays, victorious journey across sky

celtic.prompt: Multi-talented deity Lugh radiating light, master of all skills, victorious and glorious, shining triumph

shinto.prompt: Sun goddess Amaterasu at full glory, light illuminating all, joy and celebration, divine radiance

advaita.name: Surya the Witness
advaita.prompt: Radiant sun deity shining without effort, childlike rider open-armed on a white horse, everything illuminated evenly, symbol of witness consciousness

cards.personalLore: FILL THIS: Your glory - what successes illuminate you? What joy do you radiate?

narrative.summary: Joy, happiness, clarity, vulnerability of being fully seen.
narrative.feel: Warmth in chest and face; shoulders drop as tension melts.
narrative.stance: Out in the open, visible; no curtains, no shadows.
narrative.scene: Child on a white horse beneath a huge sun, arms wide; wall crumbled to let light pour in.
narrative.question: Where could honest joy shine more—and where are you using positivity to avoid a harder truth?

traditional.name: Judgement
traditional.prompt: Angel Gabriel blowing trumpet with cross banner, dead rising from coffins, mountains and water, resurrection and calling to higher purpose

lordOfMysteries.abilities: Death Judgment, Undead Control, Resurrection
lordOfMysteries.prompt: Death presiding in a hall of spirits, black flag with white rose unfurled. Commands zombies and wraiths, summons dead to fight, crosses freely into the spirit world. In one breath resurrects, in another annihilates; cold and decay bend around them. Keys of the gate hang at their belt; souls queue for judgment.

egyptian.prompt: Osiris presiding over Hall of Two Truths, weighing hearts against feather of Ma'at, judgment of souls, resurrection for worthy

celtic.prompt: Deity Donn calling souls to Tech Duinn, judgment of ancestors, gathering of the dead, cycle of rebirth

shinto.prompt: Judge deity Emma-O with mirror of karma, souls being judged for rebirth, truth revealed, karmic judgment

advaita.name: Moksha Awakening
advaita.prompt: Conch blast awakening dreamers, figures rising in golden light realizing they were never bound, soft doors of sleep opening to boundless awareness

cards.personalLore: FILL THIS: Your judgment - what calls you higher? What has been resurrected in you?

narrative.summary: Decision, reflection, awakening, call to step out of old selves.
narrative.feel: Shiver up the spine, like hearing your name from far and near at once.
narrative.stance: Among others who are also called; judged as part of a wider unfolding.
narrative.scene: Figures rise from open coffins as a horn sounds; terrified and relieved, seeing clearly.
narrative.question: If you answered the call to become who you secretly know you are, what life must you leave behind?

traditional.name: The World
traditional.prompt: A naked figure dancing in wreath, holding two wands, four winged creatures in corners (angel, eagle, lion, bull), completion and fulfillment

lordOfMysteries.abilities: Knowledge Preservation, History Recording, Complete Understanding
lordOfMysteries.prompt: Hermit of the White Tower at the center of all knowledge, both scientific and mystical. Analytic diagrams and spell arrays float; they mimic powers by observation, see futures and deduce pasts, observe and use the laws of reality directly. Every hidden datum about a person glows around them. Wreath of constellations, books and devices in orbit, perfect fulfillment.

egyptian.prompt: Creator god Atum in complete form, all creation finished, wearing both crowns, ultimate wholeness and completion

celtic.prompt: Goddess of sovereignty offering cup of completion, united kingdom, all quests fulfilled, perfect wholeness

shinto.prompt: Central deity with all creation complete and balanced, cosmic dance finished, perfect fulfillment of all things

advaita.name: Purnam
advaita.prompt: Dancer within a cosmic wreath dissolving into endless sky, no outside edge, mantra 'Purnamadah Purnamidam' subtly inscribed, serene unity and playful lila

cards.personalLore: FILL THIS: Your completion - what cycles have you finished? What world have you created?

narrative.summary: Fulfillment, integration, completion, stillness at the end of a dance.
narrative.feel: Wide, spacious ease; nothing urgent, ready to begin again.
narrative.stance: In harmony with many circles; not needing to be the center.
narrative.scene: Figure dances within a wreath, one foot about to step out; four elements watch as witnesses.
narrative.question: Now that you have arrived, what new journey are you willing to begin as a beginner again?

defaultSettings.promptSuffix: , highly detailed, cinematic lighting, tarot card art style, masterpiece quality

google/gemini-2.5-flash-image.note: Fast & Free tier available - $0.30/M input, $2.50/M output tokens
